{\rtf1 ways}
{\rtf1 they're either verbs or adjectives that}
{\rtf1 refer to belief or hope in the future so}

{\rtf1 examples we've got a hedged sentence the}
{\rtf1 results could indicate that we should}

{\rtf1 unhedged we should reallocate resources}
{\rtf1 based on the results so two things I}
{\rtf1 want to point out to this with these}
{\rtf1 with this example in academic writing}
{\rtf1 authors often tend to hedge purposefully}
{\rtf1 right and so if you're conducting}
{\rtf1 academic research you can't be certain}
{\rtf1 because there are certain caveats that}
{\rtf1 we have to work within when we're}
{\rtf1 reporting our results of academic}
{\rtf1 research so if you're editing academic}
{\rtf1 research it may be good to leave the}
{\rtf1 hedges in or ask your author}
{\rtf1 to actually introduce hedges in}
{\rtf1 professional writing we typically don't}
{\rtf1 need to hedge quite as much because}
{\rtf1 we're looking for an actionable decision}
{\rtf1 right our writing is going to be create}
{\rtf1 some kind of action or some kind of}
{\rtf1 response}
{\rtf1 so the unhedged version is probably more}
{\rtf1 appropriate in a professional document}
{\rtf1 than an academic document a quick}
{\rtf1 teaching tip we can bring bring in}
{\rtf1 discussions of audience when we teach}
{\rtf1 hedging right so this idea of academic}
